body:
Though I can leveraging the custom configuration scope (`--configure-scope`) normally if I activate a Spack environment it is no longer recognized.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

In this example I used a simple `config.yaml` and have observed the same behavior with other files declared using this method.

```console
$ cat tst-cfg/config.yaml 
config:
  debug: true
  checksum: false
$ spack env activate test
$ spack -C test-config/ config blame config | grep debug
_builtin                                                      debug: False
$ despacktivate
$ spack -C test-config/ config blame config | grep debug
test-config/config.yaml:2                                     debug: True
...
```

### Error Message

There is not a definitive error message for this; however, if I run the same commands with the debug flag:

```console
$ spack -d -C tst-cfg/ config blame config
==> [2019-03-25-15:25:56.080029] Reading config file /spack/etc/spack/defaults/modules.yaml
==> [2019-03-25-15:25:56.093739] Reading config file /spack/etc/spack/defaults/linux/modules.yaml
==> [2019-03-25-15:25:56.102192] Reading config file /spack/etc/spack/defaults/config.yaml
==> [2019-03-25-15:25:56.118690] Reading config file tst-cfg/config.yaml
---                                        config:
command_line                                 debug: True
tst-cfg/config.yaml:3                        checksum: False
...
$ spack env activate test 
$ spack env status
==> In environment test
$ spack -d -C tst-cfg/ config blame config
==> [2019-03-25-16:17:24.852407] Reading config file /spack/etc/spack/defaults/modules.yaml
==> [2019-03-25-16:17:24.861573] Reading config file /spack/etc/spack/defaults/linux/modules.yaml
==> [2019-03-25-16:17:24.867582] Reading config file /spack/var/spack/environments/test/spack.yaml
==> [2019-03-25-16:17:24.872795] Reading config file /spack/etc/spack/defaults/config.yaml
---                                        config:
command_line                                 debug: True
/spack/etc/spack/defaults/config.yaml:77     checksum: True
...
```

The command line configuration scope (in this case `-d`) is in fact recognized.

### Information on your system

I have been able to reproduce this regardless of the operating system / architecture used.

### Notes

I also attempted to do some debugging regarding this issue; however, it is not definitive as I'm by no means knowledgable enough on Spack's source.

When looking at `main.py` the environment is checked before configuration scopes. This order means that `def prepare_config_scope(env):` will be executed from the `envrionment.py` file seemingly using the environments defined scope before the configuration  singleton (`def _config()`) in `config.py` is run. One potential fix seems to re-order those as such:

```python
def main(argv=None)
    ...
    if args.config_scopes:
        spack.config.command_line_scopes = args.config_scopes
    ...
    if not args.no_env:
        env = ev.find_environment(args)
```

Not sure if this would be the best solution or would present other issues.
title: Customer scope configuration does not function in Spack Envrionments
